title: How many marks is need to clear IIT? - Quora
tags: College and University Exams in India
Indian Institutes of Technology Student Experience
College and University Advice in India

response.answer_text: Since no amount of guessing can lead us to any correct figure,that’s why I have shared the marks vs ranks which are included in the the JEE Reports of previous 8 years which will give you a lot of closure and insights about the scores of various candidates. You can check out this official website of IIT Roorkee for all these above mentioned links. Now comes the analysis part which I personally went through during my preparation and so I am sharing it with you guys. If you look at the trend of previous years then you can see for yourself that approx. 50% marks out of the total can do wonders for you leaving the exception of JEE ADVANCED 2017 conducted by IIT MADRAS as it had a lot of bonus marks(18 to be precise) and that year the Mathematics section was quite easy and scoring. That being said every year many candidates fail to secure this 50% also due to various reasons.The difficulty of this year’s paper was high as analysed by some of the reputable coaching institutes like Allen and Resonance. Especially Physics and Mathematics section was difficult and questions in Maths were lengthy.This can prove to be a determining factor in the overall scores and ranks of candidates.On the other hand Chemistry was too easy and many people are claiming it to be the easiest section in the entire paper. So it’s better if you are preparing for the next year’s JEE Advanced that you focus on studying hard and revising everything that you have completed previously at regular intervals.Revision and practicing past year papers is the most essential and important part of your preparations and should not be avoided in any scenario. Don’t stress on securing a fixed percentage and never keep a number in mind while attempting your papers be it your coaching AITS or the actual JEE ADVANCED paper because you never know how others are going to fare in the same paper which you are giving like it happened in 2017.The best thing which you can focus on is attempting maximum questions correctly and putting your best efforts in your preparations. Never let your past marks and failures in previous coaching tests trouble or disturb your studies.I understand that it will put you off at times but the people who have qualified JEE Advanced and other competitive exams have gone through the same challenging phase as yours but the only thing which helped them see it all through was the belief in their preparation and their self motivation which are the integral components to have under stress situations which JEE will present to you. Learn from your mistakes in previous papers and try not to repeat them.Whenever you write your next coaching paper browse quickly through the previous ones and see where did you go wrong. Analysis of past papers can improve your score considerably and can do wonders for you.Remember one thing that JEE Advanced is a relative exam. The rank which you will get also depends on the competition around you. You can’t do anything about the toughness of competition but don’t make it easy for anyone to get past you.When you are fighting against odds don’t forget that you are also a part of that race and competition. You fail,You try and You repeat the cycle until You achieve your goal. On an ending note I will also advise you not to day dream about your success rather put your efforts in making all those dreams come true.[1] Footnotes[1] https://jeeadv.ac.in/archives/jee-reports.html

It actually differs every year as difficulty level is different . Some paper can be hard and some can be easy! So every year cutoff changes… If you want to get into a good collage then don't focus on cutoff , Aim for high. You will get their soon ..

Leave the marks system. Percentage is the actual criteria. 366 is no fixed mark for jee. Getting 240 per 504 is not a highly useful thing. Hence for a decent rank, 60–80% helps and those under 100 generally have 80–95%. All the best.

For a good branch and college through IIT JEE Mains, you need 200+ marks. And for a good IIT, you need atleast 50% marks in IIT JEE Advanced examination. Best Wishes SATNARA IIT AIIMS ACADEMY (An initiative by IITians.. :) ) Mayur Vihar, Delhi
Given below is the table with JEE cutoff marks for different categories from 2013 to 2019. I hope this answers your question  wishing you all the best
Well dat's a real tough question to answer because every prediction this year was burned down to zero….score as much as you can. Anything above 65%will be safe.
The first thing is JEE is totally dependend on relative performance so never build a target for JEE mains and advance.
It mostly depends on the number of people qualifying that varies Year after year but still scoring 150–180 will be a good score. For getting into IIT.
75% and a decent rank in JEE advanced is required for admission in IITs
Do u mean by it, to get admission into IITs. In jee(adv) , although it vary from year to year, but minimum 45 to 50 % marks is required
To get into IIT first clear jee mains and then in jee advance if you manage to get 50 percent, you will surely get into iit!
Firstly u need to clear jee mains and then you need to get approx 200 marks in jee advanced
There are around 10500 seats in all the 23 IITs and if you belong to Gen cat , AIR of 5k may fetch you a seat .
In 12th boards you should be in the top 60 percentile to appear for iit jee.
